api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: iOS Attribution

urlencoded.description: Required. Your API key.

urlencoded.value: {"event_type":"[YOUR COMPANY] Install", "idfa": "AEBE52E7-03EE-455A-B3C4-E57283966239", "user_properties": {"[YOUR COMPANY] media source": "facebook", "[YOUR COMPANY] campaign": "refer-a-friend"}, "platform": "ios"}
urlencoded.description: Required. A request parameter representing the event, in JSON format.

functionality:
## Required Event Argument Keys

You must include the following keys within the event argument:

| Required Key | Description | Example

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Android Attribution
api_call: https://api2.amplitude.com/attribution?api_key={{api_key}}&event={"event_type":"[YOUR COMPANY] Install","adid": "AEBE52E7-03EE-455A-B3C4-E57283966239", "user_properties": {"[YOUR COMPANY] media source": "facebook", "[YOUR COMPANY] campaign": "refer-a-friend"}, "platform": "android"}
functionality: See the documentation of iOS Attribution for full details.

functionality:
The `sync_ID` is in the URL of the streaming settings page. For example: \`https://analytics.amplitude.com/amplitude/connections/project/PROJECT_ID/setup-integration/event_streaming/DESTINATION_TYPE/**SYNC_ID**/settings\`

The `sync_ID` in the URL is base64-encoded.

functionality: The `sync_ID` is under the sync title on the destination's settings page in Amplitude Data.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Upload Request

body.raw:
{
  "api_key": "{{api_key}}",
  "events": [
    {
      "user_id": "datamonster@gmail.com",
      "device_id": "C8F9E604-F01A-4BD9-95C6-8E5357DF265D",
      "event_type": "watch_tutorial",
      "time": 1396381378123,
      "event_properties": {
        "load_time": 0.8371,
        "source": "notification",
        "dates": [
          "monday",
          "tuesday"
        ]
      },
      "user_properties": {
        "age": 25,
        "gender": "female",
        "interests": [
          "chess",
          "football",
          "music"
        ]
      },
      "groups": {
        "team_id": "1",
        "company_name": [
          "Amplitude",
          "DataMonster"
        ]
      },
      "app_version": "2.1.3",
      "platform": "iOS",
      "os_name": "Android",
      "os_version": "4.2.2",
      "device_brand": "Verizon",
      "device_manufacturer": "Apple",
      "device_model": "iPhone 9,1",
      "carrier": "Verizon",
      "country": "United States",
      "region": "California",
      "city": "San Francisco",
      "dma": "San Francisco-Oakland-San Jose, CA",
      "language": "English",
      "price": 4.99,
      "quantity": 3,
      "revenue": -1.99,
      "productId": "Google Pay Store Product Id",
      "revenueType": "Refund",
      "location_lat": 37.77,
      "location_lng": -122.39,
      "ip": "127.0.0.1",
      "idfa": "AEBE52E7-03EE-455A-B3C4-E57283966239",
      "idfv": "BCCE52E7-03EE-321A-B3D4-E57123966239",
      "adid": "AEBE52E7-03EE-455A-B3C4-E57283966239",
      "android_id": "BCCE52E7-03EE-321A-B3D4-E57123966239",
      "event_id": 23,
      "session_id": 1396381378123,
      "insert_id": "5f0adeff-6668-4427-8d02-57d803a2b841"
    }
  ]
}

functionality: Updates the Amplitude user with the given ID. `id` must be a valid email address, and the user must have

functionality: Deletes the Amplitude user with the given ID. The ID must be a valid email, and the user must have

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Create Event Type

urlencoded.description: Required. String. The name of the event type.
Optional. String. The event type's category.
Optional. String. Details about the event type.

functionality:
Creates an event type.

Note: You must [initialize the schema](https://help.amplitude.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047579451) before you can add event types via the API.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Get all Event Types
functionality: Retrieves all event types in a project. There are no required parameters for this request.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Get an Event Type
functionality: Get a single event type, by name.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Update an Event Type

urlencoded.description: Optional. String. The event type's new name.
Optional. Current category name of the event type.
Optional. String. Details to add to the event type.
Optional. String. Display name of an event type.  You can update the display name for an event type only after it is ingested into Amplitude.

functionality: Update an event type.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Delete Event Type
functionality: Delete an event type.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Create Event Property

urlencoded.description: Required. Name of the event type to which the event properties belong to.
Required. Name of the event property.
Optional. String. The event property's description.
Optional. String. Available only with Govern Add-on. Data type of the event property. Acceptable values are 'string', 'number', 'boolean', 'enum', and 'any'

Optional. String. Available only with Govern Add-on. Regular expression, custom regex that can be used for pattern matching or more complex values. (e.g. property zip code must have pattern [0-9]{5} )
Optional. String. Available only with Govern Add-on. List of allowed values.
Optional. Boolean. Available only with Govern Add-on. True or false values only.
Optional. Boolean. Available only with Govern Add-on. Marks the property as required.

functionality: Creates event property.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Get Event Properties

urlencoded.description: Required. Name of the event type to which the event properties belong to.

functionality: Gets all of an event's properties.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Get Event Property

urlencoded.description: Required. Name of the event type to which the event properties belong to.

functionality: Gets an event property.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Update Event Property

urlencoded.description: Required. Name of the event type to which the event properties belong to.
Optional. String. The event property's description.
Optional. String. Available only with Govern Add-on. The new name of the event property.
Optional. String. Available only with Govern Add-on. Data type of the event property. Acceptable values are 'string', 'number', 'boolean', 'enum', and 'any'

Optional. String. Available only with Govern Add-on. Regular expression, custom regex that can be used for pattern matching or more complex values. (e.g. property zip code must have pattern [0-9]{5} )
Optional. String. Available only with Govern Add-on. List of allowed values.
Optional. Boolean. Available only with Govern Add-on. True or false values only.
Optional. Boolean. Available only with Govern Add-on. Marks the property as required.

functionality: Updates an event property.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Delete Event Property

urlencoded.description: Required. Name of the event type to which the event properties belong to.

functionality: Deletes an event property.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Create User Property

urlencoded.description: Optional. String. Name of the user property type.
Optional. String. Details to add to the user property type.
Optional. String. Data type of the user property. Acceptable values are `string` `number`, `boolean`, `enum`, and `any`.
Optional. String. Regular expression or custom regex that can be used for pattern matching and more complex values (e.g. 'zip code' property must have pattern [0-9]{5} ).
Optional. String. List of allowed values, separated by comma. For example: red, yellow, blue.
Optional. Specifies whether or not property value is an array. Allowable values are 'true' and 'false'.

functionality: Create a user property.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Get User Property
functionality: Retrieves a single user property, by name.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Get All User Properties
functionality: Retrieves all user properties in your account. This call doesn't have any required parameters.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Update User Property

urlencoded.description: Optional. String. New name of the user property type.
Optional. String. Details to add to the user property type.
Optional. String. Data type of the user property. Acceptable values are `string` `number`, `boolean`, `enum`, and `any`.
Optional. String. Regular expression or custom regex that can be used for pattern matching and more complex values (e.g. 'zip code' property must have pattern [0-9]{5} ).
Optional. String. List of allowed values, separated by comma. For example: red, yellow, blue.
Optional. Specifies whether or not property value is an array. Allowable values are 'true' and 'false'.

functionality: Update a user property.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Delete User Property
functionality: Deletes a single user property, by name.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Mapping Request
functionality: Maps a user ID to a global user ID. You can map a single user ID per JSON mapping object.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Unmapping Request
functionality: Unmaps a user ID to any associated global ID. You can unmap a single user ID per JSON mapping object.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: POST Deletion Request (JSON)
functionality: Request a user be scheduled for deletion using a JSON body. Specify up to 100 users at a time. A

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: GET Deletion Requests
functionality: Retrieves a list list deletion jobs scheduled in a time range; this time range should include the date you made

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: DELETE Deletion Request
functionality: Removes the specified ID from a deletion job.

api_name: Amplitude Analytics APIs: Get User Profile
functionality: Retrieves a single user profile.
